table.name: biomass_forest_types
table.remarks: (Enum) Types for forest in a biomass observation.

table.name: deliveries
table.remarks: Incoming deliveries of new seedlings to a planting site. Mostly exists to link plantings and nursery withdrawals.

column.name: withdrawal_id
column.remarks: Which nursery withdrawal the plants came from.

column.name: planting_site_id
column.remarks: Which planting site received the delivery.

column.name: created_by
column.remarks: Which user created the delivery.

column.name: created_time
column.remarks: When the delivery was created.

column.name: modified_by
column.remarks: Which user most recently modified the delivery.

column.name: modified_time
column.remarks: When the delivery was most recently modified.

column.name: reassigned_by
column.remarks: Which user recorded the reassignment of plants in this delivery. Null if this delivery has no reassignment.

column.name: reassigned_time
column.remarks: When the reassignment was recorded. Null if this delivery has no reassignment.

table.name: draft_planting_sites
table.remarks: Details of planting sites that are in the process of being defined.

column.name: num_strata
column.remarks: Number of strata defined so far.

column.name: num_substrata
column.remarks: Number of substrata defined so far.

column.name: data
column.remarks: Client-defined state of the definition of the planting site. This may include a mix of map data and application state and is treated as opaque by the server.

table.name: mangrove_tides
table.remarks: (Enum) High/Low tide at a mangrove during an observation.

table.name: monitoring_plot_histories
table.remarks: Versions of monitoring plots over time. Each time a planting site changes, its monitoring plots are added to this table.

column.name: created_by
column.remarks: Which user created or edited the monitoring plot or its planting site.

column.name: created_time
column.remarks: When the monitoring plot was created, edited, or associated with a new planting site history record. May differ from the time when the substratum or planting site was created or edited since plots can be created when observations start.

table.name: monitoring_plot_overlaps
table.remarks: Which monitoring plots overlap with previously-used monitoring plots. A plot may overlap with multiple older or newer plots.

column.name: monitoring_plot_id
column.remarks: ID of the newer monitoring plot.

column.name: overlaps_plot_id
column.remarks: ID of the older monitoring plot.

table.name: monitoring_plots
table.remarks: Regions within substrata that can be comprehensively surveyed in order to extrapolate results for the entire stratum. Any monitoring plot in a substratum is expected to have roughly the same number of plants of the same species as any other monitoring plot in the same substratum.

column.name: substratum_id
column.remarks: Which substratum this monitoring plot is currently part of, if any. May be null if the substratum was edited or removed after the plot was created, or if the plot was created outside the site boundary.

column.name: created_by
column.remarks: Which user created the monitoring plot.

column.name: created_time
column.remarks: When the monitoring plot was originally created.

column.name: modified_by
column.remarks: Which user most recently modified the monitoring plot.

column.name: modified_time
column.remarks: When the monitoring plot was most recently modified.

column.name: boundary
column.remarks: Boundary of the monitoring plot. Coordinates always use SRID 4326 (WGS 84 latitude/longitude).

column.name: permanent_index
column.remarks: If this plot is a candidate to be a permanent monitoring plot, its position in the randomized list of plots for the stratum. Starts at 1 for each stratum. If null, this plot is not currently a candidate for selection as a permanent plot but may still be chosen as a temporary plot.

column.name: size_meters
column.remarks: Length in meters of one side of the monitoring plot. Plots are always squares, so for a 30x30m plot, this would be 30.

column.name: plot_number
column.remarks: User-visible identifier of this plot. Plot numbers are sequential and start at 1 for each organization.

table.name: observable_conditions
table.remarks: (Enum) Conditions that can be observed in a monitoring plot.

table.name: observation_biomass_details
table.remarks: Recorded data for a biomass observation.

column.name: water_depth_cm
column.remarks: Depth of water in centimeters (cm). Must be non-null if forest type is "Mangrove".

column.name: salinity_ppt
column.remarks: Salinity of water in parts per thousand (ppt). Must be non-null if forest type is "Mangrove".

column.name: ph
column.remarks: Acidity of water in pH. Must only exists if forest type is "Mangrove".

column.name: tide_id
column.remarks: High/low tide during observation. Must be non-null if forest type is "Mangrove".

column.name: tide_time
column.remarks: Time when the tide is recorded. Must be non-null if forest type is "Mangrove".

checkConstraint.constraint: (((forest_type_id = 1) AND (water_depth_cm IS NULL) AND (salinity_ppt IS NULL) AND (ph IS NULL) AND (tide_id IS NULL) AND (tide_time IS NULL)) OR ((forest_type_id = 2) AND (water_depth_cm IS NOT NULL) AND (salinity_ppt IS NOT NULL) AND (ph IS NOT NULL) AND (tide_id IS NOT NULL) AND (tide_time IS NOT NULL)))
checkConstraint.name: mangrove_required_values

table.name: observation_biomass_quadrat_details
table.remarks: Details of a biomass observation at each quadrat of a monitoring plot.

table.name: observation_biomass_quadrat_species
table.remarks: Herbaceous species at each quadrat of a monitoring plot of a biomass observation

table.name: observation_biomass_species
table.remarks: Herbaceous and tree species data for a biomass observation.

column.name: species_id
column.remarks: The ID of the plant's species, if known.

column.name: scientific_name
column.remarks: The user-supplied scientific name of the plant's species. Must be provided if ID is null. Null if ID is known.

column.name: common_name
column.remarks: The user-supplied common name of the plant's species. Null if ID is known.

checkConstraint.constraint: (((species_id IS NOT NULL) AND (scientific_name IS NULL)) OR ((species_id IS NULL) AND (scientific_name IS NOT NULL)))
checkConstraint.name: species_identifier

table.name: observation_media_files
table.remarks: Observation-specific details about a photo or video of a monitoring plot. Generic metadata is in the `files` table.

column.name: is_original
column.remarks: If true, this photo was uploaded as part of the original observation data. If false, this photo was added after the observation.

table.name: observation_media_types
table.remarks: (Enum) Types of observation plot media. This refers to the type of thing that's being depicted, not the content type of the media file.

table.name: observation_plot_conditions
table.remarks: List of conditions observed in each monitoring plot.

table.name: observation_plot_positions
table.remarks: (Enum) Positions in a monitoring plot where users can take photos or record coordinates.

table.name: observation_plot_statuses
table.remarks: (Enum) The status of an observation plot.

table.name: observation_plots
table.remarks: Information about monitoring plots that are required to be surveyed as part of observations. This is not populated until the scheduled start time of the observation.

column.name: completed_time
column.remarks: Server-generated completion date and time. This is the time the observation was submitted to the server, not the time it was performed in the field.

column.name: is_permanent
column.remarks: If true, this plot was selected for observation as a permanent monitoring plot. If false, this plot was selected as a temporary monitoring plot.

column.name: observed_time
column.remarks: Client-supplied observation date and time. This is the time the observation was performed in the field, not the time it was submitted to the server.

checkConstraint.constraint: ((completed_by IS NULL) OR ((completed_by IS NOT NULL) AND (claimed_by IS NOT NULL)))
checkConstraint.name: cannot_unclaim_completed_plot

table.name: observation_requested_substrata
table.remarks: If an observation should only cover a specific set of substrata, the substratum IDs are stored here. If an observation is of the entire site (the default), there will be no rows for that observation in this table.

table.name: observation_states
table.remarks: (Enum) Where in the observation lifecycle a particular observation is.

table.name: observation_types
table.remarks: (Enum) Type of observation, currently only used for ad hoc observations.

table.name: observations
table.remarks: Scheduled observations of planting sites. This table may contain rows describing future observations as well as current and past ones.

column.name: start_date
column.remarks: First day of the observation. This is either the first day of the month following the end of the planting season, or 6 months after that day.

column.name: end_date
column.remarks: Last day of the observation. This is typically the last day of the same month as `start_date`.

column.name: completed_time
column.remarks: Server-generated date and time the final piece of data for the observation was received.

column.name: upcoming_notification_sent_time
column.remarks: When the notification that the observation is starting in 1 month was sent. Null if the notification has not been sent yet.

column.name: planting_site_history_id
column.remarks: Which version of the planting site map was used for the observation. Null for upcoming observations since monitoring plots are only placed on the map when an observation starts.

checkConstraint.constraint: (((completed_time IS NULL) AND (state_id <> ALL (ARRAY[3, 5]))) OR ((completed_time IS NOT NULL) AND (state_id = ANY (ARRAY[3, 5]))))
checkConstraint.name: completed_time_and_state

checkConstraint.constraint: (((state_id = 1) AND (planting_site_history_id IS NULL)) OR ((state_id <> 1) AND (planting_site_history_id IS NOT NULL)))
checkConstraint.name: history_id_required_at_start

table.name: observed_plot_coordinates
table.remarks: Observed GPS coordinates in monitoring plots. Does not include photo coordinates or coordinates of recorded plants.

table.name: observed_plot_species_totals
table.remarks: Aggregated per-monitoring-plot, per-species totals of plants recorded during observations.

column.name: mortality_rate
column.remarks: If this is a permanent monitoring plot, percentage of plants of the species observed in this plot, in either this observation or in previous ones, that were dead. Null if this is not a permanent monitoring plot in the current observation.

column.name: cumulative_dead
column.remarks: If this is a permanent monitoring plot, total number of dead plants observed in all observations including the current one.

column.name: permanent_live
column.remarks: If this is a permanent monitoring plot, the number of live and existing plants observed. 0 otherwise.

column.name: survival_rate
column.remarks: If this is a permanent monitoring plot, percentage of plants of the species observed in this plot, in either this observation or in previous ones, that have survived since the t0 point. Null if this is not a permanent monitoring plot in the current observation.

checkConstraint.constraint: (((certainty_id = 1) AND (species_id IS NOT NULL) AND (species_name IS NULL)) OR ((certainty_id = 2) AND (species_id IS NULL) AND (species_name IS NOT NULL)) OR ((certainty_id = 3) AND (species_id IS NULL) AND (species_name IS NULL)))
checkConstraint.name: species_identifier_for_certainty

table.name: observed_site_species_totals
table.remarks: Aggregated per-planting-site, per-species totals of plants recorded during observations.

column.name: mortality_rate
column.remarks: Percentage of plants of the species observed in permanent monitoring plots in the planting site, in either this observation or in previous ones, that were dead.

column.name: cumulative_dead
column.remarks: Total number of dead plants of the species observed, both in this observation and in all previous ones, in plots that are included as permanent plots in this observation.

column.name: permanent_live
column.remarks: The number of live and existing plants observed in permanent monitoring plots.

column.name: survival_rate
column.remarks: Percentage of plants of the species observed in permanent monitoring plots in the planting site, in either this observation or in previous ones, that have survived since the t0 point.

checkConstraint.constraint: (((certainty_id = 1) AND (species_id IS NOT NULL) AND (species_name IS NULL)) OR ((certainty_id = 2) AND (species_id IS NULL) AND (species_name IS NOT NULL)) OR ((certainty_id = 3) AND (species_id IS NULL) AND (species_name IS NULL)))
checkConstraint.name: species_identifier_for_certainty

table.name: observed_stratum_species_totals
table.remarks: Aggregated per-stratum, per-species totals of plants recorded during observations.

column.name: mortality_rate
column.remarks: Percentage of plants of the species observed in permanent monitoring plots in the stratum, in either the current observation or in previous ones, that were dead.

column.name: cumulative_dead
column.remarks: Total number of dead plants of the species observed, both in this observation and in all previous ones, in plots in this stratum that are included as permanent plots in this observation.

column.name: permanent_live
column.remarks: The number of live and existing plants observed in permanent monitoring plots.

column.name: survival_rate
column.remarks: Percentage of plants of the species observed in permanent monitoring plots in the stratum, in either the current observation or in previous ones, that have survived since the t0 point.

checkConstraint.constraint: (((certainty_id = 1) AND (species_id IS NOT NULL) AND (species_name IS NULL)) OR ((certainty_id = 2) AND (species_id IS NULL) AND (species_name IS NOT NULL)) OR ((certainty_id = 3) AND (species_id IS NULL) AND (species_name IS NULL)))
checkConstraint.name: species_identifier_for_certainty

table.name: observed_substratum_species_totals
table.remarks: Aggregated per-substratum, per-species totals of plants recorded during observations.

column.name: mortality_rate
column.remarks: Percentage of plants of the species observed in permanent monitoring plots in the substratum, in either the current observation or in previous ones, that were dead.

column.name: cumulative_dead
column.remarks: Total number of dead plants of the species observed, both in this observation and in all previous ones, in plots in this substratum that are included as permanent plots in this observation.

column.name: permanent_live
column.remarks: The number of live and existing plants observed in permanent monitoring plots.

column.name: survival_rate
column.remarks: Percentage of plants of the species observed in permanent monitoring plots in the substratum, in either the current observation or in previous ones, that have survived since the t0 point.

checkConstraint.constraint: (((certainty_id = 1) AND (species_id IS NOT NULL) AND (species_name IS NULL)) OR ((certainty_id = 2) AND (species_id IS NULL) AND (species_name IS NOT NULL)) OR ((certainty_id = 3) AND (species_id IS NULL) AND (species_name IS NULL)))
checkConstraint.name: species_identifier_for_certainty

table.name: planting_seasons
table.remarks: Start and end dates of planting seasons for planting sites.

column.name: start_date
column.remarks: What day the planting season starts.

column.name: start_time
column.remarks: When the planting season will start. This is midnight on `start_date` in the planting site's time zone.

column.name: end_date
column.remarks: What day the planting season ends. This is the last day of the season, not the day after the season, that is, if the planting season is the month of January, this will be January 31, not February 1.

column.name: end_time
column.remarks: When the planting season will be finished. This is midnight on the day after `end_date` in the planting site's time zone.

column.name: is_active
column.remarks: True if the planting season is currently in progress. Only one planting season can be active at a time for a planting site.

table.name: planting_site_histories
table.remarks: Versions of planting site maps over time. Each time a planting site map changes, the new map is inserted into this table and its child tables.

column.name: created_time
column.remarks: When the site map was created or updated. You can determine which map was active for a site at a particular time by looking for the maximum `created_time` less than or equal to the time in question.

table.name: planting_site_notifications
table.remarks: Tracks which notifications have already been sent regarding planting sites.

column.name: notification_number
column.remarks: Number of notifications of this type that have been sent, including this one. 1 for initial notification, 2 for reminder, 3 for second reminder, etc.

table.name: planting_site_populations
table.remarks: Total number of plants of each species in each planting site.

table.name: planting_sites
table.remarks: Top-level information about entire planting sites. Every planting site has at least one stratum.

column.name: organization_id
column.remarks: Which organization owns this planting site.

column.name: name
column.remarks: Short name of this planting site. Must be unique within the organization.

column.name: description
column.remarks: Optional user-supplied description of the planting site.

column.name: boundary
column.remarks: Boundary of the entire planting site. strata will generally fall inside this boundary. This will typically be a single polygon but may be multiple polygons if a planting site has several disjoint areas. Coordinates always use SRID 4326 (WGS 84 latitude/longitude).

column.name: created_by
column.remarks: Which user created the planting site.

column.name: created_time
column.remarks: When the planting site was originally created.

column.name: modified_by
column.remarks: Which user most recently modified the planting site.

column.name: modified_time
column.remarks: When the planting site was most recently modified.

column.name: exclusion
column.remarks: Optional area to exclude from a site. No monitoring plots will be located in this area.

column.name: grid_origin
column.remarks: Coordinates of the origin point of the grid of monitoring plots. Monitoring plot corners have X and Y coordinates that are multiples of 25 meters from the origin point.

table.name: planting_types
table.remarks: (Enum) Type of planting associated with a delivery. Different planting types distinguish reassignments from initial plantings.

table.name: plantings
table.remarks: Details about plants that were planted or reassigned as part of a delivery. There is one plantings row per species in a delivery.

column.name: delivery_id
column.remarks: Which delivery this planting is part of.

column.name: planting_type_id
column.remarks: Whether this is the plant assignment from the initial delivery or an adjustment from a reassignment.

column.name: planting_site_id
column.remarks: Which planting site has the planting. Must be the same as the planting site ID of the delivery. This identifies the site as a whole; in addition, there may be a plot ID.

column.name: substratum_id
column.remarks: Which plot this planting affected, if any. Must be a plot at the planting site referenced by `planting_site_id`. Null if the planting site does not have plot information. For reassignments, this is the original plot if `num_plants` is negative, or the new plot if `num_plants` is positive.

column.name: species_id
column.remarks: Which species was planted.

column.name: created_by
column.remarks: Which user created the planting.

column.name: created_time
column.remarks: When the planting was created. Note that plantings are never updated, so there is no modified time.

column.name: num_plants
column.remarks: Number of plants that were planted (if the number is positive) or reassigned (if the number is negative).

column.name: notes
column.remarks: Notes about this specific planting. In the initial version of the web app, the user can only enter per-planting notes for reassignments, not for initial deliveries.

table.name: plot_t0_densities
table.remarks: Density for a plot per species, in plants per hectare.

table.name: plot_t0_observations
table.remarks: Which observation to use to determine t0 plot density.

table.name: recorded_plant_statuses
table.remarks: (Enum) Possible statuses of a plant recorded during observation of a monitoring plot.

table.name: recorded_plants
table.remarks: Information about individual plants observed in monitoring plots.

column.name: species_id
column.remarks: If certainty is "Known," the ID of the plant's species. Null for other certainty values.

column.name: species_name
column.remarks: If certainty is "Other," the user-supplied name of the plant's species. Null for other certainty values.

checkConstraint.constraint: (((certainty_id = 1) AND (species_id IS NOT NULL) AND (species_name IS NULL)) OR ((certainty_id = 2) AND (species_id IS NULL)) OR ((certainty_id = 3) AND (species_id IS NULL) AND (species_name IS NULL)))
checkConstraint.name: species_info_matches_certainty

table.name: recorded_species_certainties
table.remarks: (Enum) Levels of certainty about the identity of a species recorded in a monitoring plot observation.

table.name: recorded_trees
table.remarks: Recorded trees or shrubs of a biomass observation.

column.name: tree_number
column.remarks: A unique incremental number starting at 1 for accounting trunks at a biomass observation. Defaults to 1 for Trees/Shrubs.

checkConstraint.constraint: (((tree_growth_form_id = 1) AND (diameter_at_breast_height_cm IS NOT NULL) AND (point_of_measurement_m IS NOT NULL) AND (shrub_diameter_cm IS NULL) AND (trunk_number = 1)) OR ((tree_growth_form_id = 2) AND (diameter_at_breast_height_cm IS NULL) AND (point_of_measurement_m IS NULL) AND (height_m IS NULL) AND (shrub_diameter_cm IS NOT NULL) AND (trunk_number = 1)) OR ((tree_growth_form_id = 3) AND (diameter_at_breast_height_cm IS NOT NULL) AND (point_of_measurement_m IS NOT NULL) AND (shrub_diameter_cm IS NULL)))
checkConstraint.name: growth_form_specific_data

table.name: strata
table.remarks: Regions within planting sites that have a consistent set of conditions such that survey results from any part of the stratum can be extrapolated to the entire stratum. strata are subdivided into plots. Every stratum has at least one plot.

column.name: planting_site_id
column.remarks: Which planting site this stratum is part of.

column.name: name
column.remarks: Short name of this stratum. This is often just a single letter. Must be unique within a planting site.

column.name: boundary
column.remarks: Boundary of the stratum. This area is further subdivided into plots. This will typically be a single polygon but may be multiple polygons if a stratum has several disjoint areas. Coordinates always use SRID 4326 (WGS 84 latitude/longitude).

column.name: created_by
column.remarks: Which user created the stratum.

column.name: created_time
column.remarks: When the stratum was originally created.

column.name: modified_by
column.remarks: Which user most recently modified the stratum.

column.name: modified_time
column.remarks: When the stratum was most recently modified.

column.name: num_permanent_plots
column.remarks: Number of permanent plots to assign to the next observation. This is typically derived from a statistical formula.

column.name: boundary_modified_by
column.remarks: Which user most recently edited the stratum's boundary.

column.name: boundary_modified_time
column.remarks: When the stratum's boundary was most recently modified.

column.name: stable_id
column.remarks: Stratum identifier that doesn't change even if the stratum is renamed or edited. Defaults to the stratum name.

table.name: stratum_histories
table.remarks: Versions of stratum maps over time. Each time a planting site map changes, its strata' maps are inserted into this table.

table.name: stratum_populations
table.remarks: Total number of plants of each species in each stratum.

table.name: stratum_t0_temp_densities
table.remarks: Density for a stratum per species, in plants per hectare. Only applies to temporary plots and only if survival_rate_includes_temp_plots is set to true for the stratum's planting site.

table.name: substrata
table.remarks: Regions within strata that are a convenient size for a planting operation. Typically <10Ha.

column.name: stratum_id
column.remarks: Which stratum this substratum is part of.

column.name: name
column.remarks: Short name of this substratum. This is often just a single letter and number. Must be unique within a stratum.

column.name: boundary
column.remarks: Boundary of the substratum. Coordinates always use SRID 4326 (WGS 84 latitude/longitude).

column.name: created_by
column.remarks: Which user created the substratum.

column.name: created_time
column.remarks: When the substratum was originally created.

column.name: modified_by
column.remarks: Which user most recently modified the substratum.

column.name: modified_time
column.remarks: When the substratum was most recently modified.

column.name: planting_site_id
column.remarks: Which planting site this substratum is part of. This is the same as the planting site ID of this substratum's stratum, but is duplicated here so it can be used as the target of a foreign key constraint.

column.name: observed_time
column.remarks: When an observation of a monitoring plot in the substratum was most recently completed.

column.name: stable_id
column.remarks: Substratum identifier that doesn't change even if the substratum is renamed or edited. Defaults to the full name.

table.name: substratum_histories
table.remarks: Versions of substratum maps over time. Each time a planting site map changes, its substrata' maps are inserted into this table.

table.name: substratum_populations
table.remarks: Total number of plants of each species in each substratum.

table.name: tree_growth_forms
table.remarks: (Enum) Growth form of each species in a biomass observation.
